sponsor: Alliance for Clinical Trials in Oncology
briefTitle: Duloxetine in Treating Peripheral Neuropathy Caused by Chemotherapy in Patients With Cancer
officialTitle: A Phase III Double Blind Trial of Oral Duloxetine for Treatment of Pain Associated With Chemotherapy-Induced Peripheral Neuropathy
conditions: Unspecified Adult Solid Tumor, Protocol Specific
summary:
RATIONALE: Duloxetine may lessen peripheral neuropathy caused by chemotherapy. It is not yet known whether duloxetine is more effective than a placebo in treating peripheral neuropathy caused by chemotherapy.

PURPOSE: This randomized phase III trial is studying duloxetine to see how well it works compared with a placebo in treating peripheral neuropathy caused by chemotherapy in patients with cancer.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change in Average Pain From Week 1 to Week 5, as Measured by the BPI-SF Average Pain Severity Item
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Day 1 of Week 1 to Day 1 of Week 6
